intro: Halimium corymbosum, commonly known as the clustered hawksbeard, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant features bright yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It has hairy, glandular leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits. Halimium corymbosum is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments.
